alert.note: Alert for Eastern Orleans; Western Orleans (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 25 at 1:35PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern St. Bernard, Orleans and northwestern Jefferson Parishes through 230 PM CDT... At 135 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Gretna, or near Marrero, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and torrential rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... New Orleans, Metairie, Chalmette, Marrero, Harvey, Avondale, East New Orleans, Timberlane, Belle Chasse, Jefferson, Gretna, Harahan, Westwego, Lake Catherine, Elmwood, Terrytown, Meraux, Bridge City, River Ridge and Arabi. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 224 and 255. Interstate 510 between mile markers 1 and 3. Interstate 610 between mile markers 1 and 4. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
